comment.text: This translation key is used to display a descriptive text next to examples of ready-to-use integrations of a specific product. It appears on a UI element in the developer tools section, likely as a header or caption, and provides context for users to understand the content of the integration examples.

usage.context:
>
 <CategoryHeader className="integration-header">
 {t("IntegrationExamples")}
 </CategoryHeader>
 <Text lineHeight="20px" color={theme.sdkPresets.secondaryColor}>
 {t("IntegrationDescription", { productName: t("Common:ProductName") })}
 </Text>
 <div className="icons">
 <div
 data-testid="integration_zoom_container"
 className="icon"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'inteqrasiyalarını' contains a spelling error. It should be 'inteqrasiyalarını'.

The translation 'Zkontrolujte integrace připravené k použití {{productName}}' is technically correct but could be more natural. 'Ready-to-use' often translates to a more concise phrase in Czech. A more natural translation would be 'Zkontrolujte připravené integrace {{productName}}' or 'Ověřte připravené integrace {{productName}}'.

The Japanese translation uses katakana for 'integrations' (統合機能). While not inherently wrong, it might be more natural and user-friendly to use a more common or simpler term depending on the target audience and context. Consider alternatives like '連携機能' or '統合' if a simpler term is preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using '連携機能' or '統合' as alternatives to '統合機能' depending on the context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ທີ່​ພ້ອມ​ສໍາລັບ​ການ​ນໍາ​ໃຊ້" (that ready for use) is a bit verbose and not the most natural way to express 'ready-to-use' in Lao. A more direct translation might be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'ທີ່ໃຊ້ໄດ້' (thi sa dai) which translates to 'available' or 'usable'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'prontas a usar' is a literal translation of 'ready-to-use'. A more natural and idiomatic Portuguese phrasing would be 'já prontas para usar' or 'prontas para uso'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verifique as integrações {{productName}} já prontas para usar

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'soluții de integrare' is too literal and doesn't quite convey the meaning of 'integrations'. A more natural Romanian phrasing would be 'integrări' or 'soluții de integrare' (though the latter is slightly more verbose).
While not strictly incorrect, the phrase 'gata de utilizare' feels slightly clunky. Consider alternatives for better flow.
The word 'ඒකාබද්ධ කිරීම්' (ekābadha karim) could be more naturally translated as 'එකාබද්ධතා' (ekābadhatā).

The translation 'Preverite integracije {{productName}}, ki so že pripravljene za uporabo' is a bit literal and could be improved for naturalness. A more idiomatic translation might be 'Preverite pripravljene integracije {{productName}}' or 'Oglejte si že pripravljene integracije {{productName}}'.

The word 'Проверите' (Proverite) is a correct translation of 'Check', but it's in the imperative mood (formal you). A more natural and user-friendly tone would be achieved with a less formal phrasing. Considering this is likely user-facing text, a more approachable phrasing would be beneficial.

The translation 'Proverite gotove integracije {{productName}}' is a literal translation but doesn't flow naturally in Serbian. A more natural phrasing would be 'Pogledajte dostupne integracije za {{productName}}' or 'Pregledajte gotove integracije {{productName}}'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Pregledajte gotove integracije {{productName}} or Pogledajte dostupne integracije za {{productName}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Kiểm tra các tích hợp {{productName}} có sẵn để sử dụng' is slightly awkward. While technically correct, a more natural phrasing would be preferred. 'Có sẵn để sử dụng' is redundant as 'tích hợp' implies readiness.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Kiểm tra các tích hợp {{productName}} sẵn có
